items.snippet: 187 Reviews of Disneyland Hotel "What's a Disney Vacation without staying at   one of the Disney Hotels?! I was a bit bummed that we were not able to check in ...
items.htmlSnippet:
187 Reviews of Disneyland Hotel "What's a Disney Vacation without staying at
one of the Disney Hotels?! I was a bit bummed that we were not able to check in ...

review.author: Michelle C.
review.description: What's a Disney Vacation without staying at one of the Disney Hotels?! I was a bit bummed that we were not able to check-in early, but hey, it was a Sunday on June. No real complaints since...

review.author: Avi M.
review.description: I had booked a room for two nights at the Disneyland Hotel for an event at the hotel's convention center. I brought my wife (who had only gotten out of the hospital a few weeks prior) and our...

review.author: Nicole B.
review.description: We LOVED our stay at the Disneyland Hotel! We just got back from a 4.5 day trip to Disneyland, our daughter's first, and my first visit in 20 years. I had initially booked us at an off-site...

review.author: Misty W.
review.description: Top notch! I loved all of the Mickey touches. From the headboard to the Disney robes, it all made for a great experience. And!...And!... each room comes with a mini frig!!! Not a frig full...

review.author: Gary E.
review.description: This hotel had recently undergone a facelift of sorts. On the exterior she really glows in a sexy metallic blue! By design it's more energy efficient and green than it has ever been before...

review.author: Leith R.
review.description: Great new rooms, but no staircase access? Even if you're on the 2nd floor? What a pain it is to wait for the slow and full elevators. Apparently Disney doesn't want to promote healthy choices,...

review.author: Veronica O.
review.description: First of all if you know me you know im a big DISNEY FREAK.. I am even a DVC MEMBER... I love Disneyland as much as i love my husband & makeup..lol Well i really do hate to write this review...

review.author: Shawna V.
review.description: I absolutely LOVED staying here! Ever since I was a little girl I always wanted to stay at the DisneyHotel. It did not let me down. The customer service was excellant. Everyone was beyond friendly,...

review.author: Denise D.
review.description: We just returned from our three night stay at the new Disneyland Hotel and I was so disappointed. We go to Disneyland at least once or twice a year and usually stay at one of the three Disneyland...

review.author: Elizabeth B.
review.description: We arrived at the Disney Hotel around 8:30 a.m., way before check-in. We had to go to the front desk to pick up our park passes, which are normally mailed to you, unless you make reservations...

review.author: Brendan W.
review.description: Disneyland Hotel a bit pricey. Character dinner at Goofy Kitchen was lame. Overpriced buffet with poor selection. More deserts than food. Pool at hotel was nice. Kids digged the slide. Eating...

review.author: Mel B.
review.description: They've just went through a room and pool remodel, so we thought we'd fork up the extra dough and stay here for the Tinkerbell Half marathon. It's all about convenience. The rooms are better....

review.author: Sarah S.
review.description: Fantastic! Almost 5 stars. My husband and I honeymooned at the Disneyland Hotel last week and were so sad to leave. Our deluxe room with a pool view was spacious and very clean. The housekeeping...

review.author: Aaron H.
review.description: After their renovation, the place is simply awesome. The new pool area is fun (except for constant need to close the pool due to...erm, little accidents), with some creatively designed slides....

review.author: AJ R.
review.description: This is just another overpriced, undervalued hotel in Disney's attempt to take over the world. The place is clean and functional but the rooms are teeny. This is also Disney's budget hotel...

review.author: Annie F.
review.description: Almost a 5-star experience. Beautiful hotel. Loved the spaciousness of the rooms, the cleanliness, the quietness, all of the amenities and the staff was great! I loved the two gift shops they...

review.author: Cynthia S.
review.description: Love the new renovations! Hadn't stayed here in about nine years or more. LOVE the Concierge Lounge because you are treated like Kings, Queens, Princesses and Princes! HA! Rooms were beautiful...

review.author: John N.
review.description: Of all the things I have ever reviewed, talking about my childhood memories, the service, the rooms, and the changing environment at the Disneyland Hotel, it's hard to give a solid review....

review.author: Julio A.
review.description: Stayed here during September 2011. Saved w/ Premium Pass holder discount. 3Day Stay. My Girlfriend, daughter and I decided to use our vacation, very luck our job even gives us that, and get...

review.author: Connie W.
review.description: For a Disney Geek, this hotel is like a sacred worship place. Walt was thoughtfully peppered everywhere and staying at the hotel was an amazing experience. It was painful to leave.

review.author: Sandy W.
review.description: It's a good lodging option as part of the comprehensive Disneyland experience. It's got the pixie dust magic with Pluto, Goofy, et al, showing up in the lobby area from time to time, and it's...

review.author: Katy R.
review.description: After spending a weekend at the Disneyland Hotel, I don't think we can ever enjoy our Premier Pass the same way again. Pricey but so worth it! Looking forward to doing it again!

review.author: Catherine Q.
review.description: This review is only for the Christmas event. The event looks really good, service is good. They played techno house music when people were eating, it didn't really bring up my appetite. Their...

review.author: J S.
review.description: I recently just spent three nights and four days at the Disneyland Hotel and I absolutely LOVED it! I haven't stayed there since I was little, and since the recent renovation, the hotel looks...

review.author: Anne T.
review.description: My friend surprised us with a trip to Disneyland. Booking tickets and hotel! The hotel itself is under renovations, but overall the service is still good. We were greeted with refreshments...

review.author: clarke t.
review.description: This review is based not on the Disneyland Hotel in and of itself. Rather a part of the Disneyland Hotel, the courtyard. As a two in a lifetime resident of Anaheim as a child and later now...

review.author: Kirk B.
review.description: My family and I stayed here recently for 3 days and for the most part was the perfect vacation. We stayed in the newest tower which is the Frontier tower on the 14th floor and stayed in a 2...

review.author: Gary M.
review.description: The Disneyland hotel is the first Disney owned hotel next to the theme park. It used to be owned by the Grandville's but enough history let's get this review started. So I am really letting...

review.author: Caren C.
review.description: If you are debating between a renovated room here or the Grand Californian -- book GC! We took the shortcut to DCA through the Grand Californian and the lobby and surroundings were just way...

review.author: Kelly J.
review.description: This review is in regards to 2 Christmas events I've attended here. Last year's event was great. The event was all held here. The company I attended with had given their employees their drink...

review.author: Jackie D.
review.description: Had a really good stay here with my family of 4, one infant and one 4 year old and 2 adults. Check in was smooth, friendly and the person helping us gave us great information on the Disneyland...

review.author: Albert P.
review.description: This was my first time ever staying at the Disneyland Hotel so my review will be based on the newly remodeled rooms only. I decided to stay here as part of an anniversary present for my girlfriend....

review.author: Jack M.
review.description: The happiest place on earth for Christmas. Oh happy days.. :) Checking in is super quick. Whether you paid for club-level or not. We paid for a 2 bedroom suite, which, (thank god!), came with...

review.author: Reena P.
review.description: I'm torn.. I think I'll stick to 3.5/5 The reason I lean towards 4: Great friendly service, convenient location RIGHT next to Downtown Disney and walking distance to Disneyland (obviously)...

review.author: Krsy S.
review.description: HOTEL- *Terrible service. Terrible. *Rooms have no soundproofing between you & the screaming baby next door. *Took me 30 minutes to get my car from valet. Took about 10 minutes for them to...

review.author: Alex L.
review.description: I did not stay here but I came for a niece's party. Her parents booked a large suite on an upper floor which was basically three attached rooms with their inner shared doors open. I expected...

review.author: Dee D.
review.description: I came here for a dental hygiene function and was not impressed. Being that my family and I visit Disneyland every year, I expected a lot more. From my experience, Disney cast members are always...

review.author: Angelica F.
review.description: I stayed here in February 2011, while they were finishing up renovations. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the new rooms. Since we had many people in our party, we got 3 suites connected...

review.author: Ron B.
review.description: Check in listed at 3pm. It is now 4:30 and we ate still waiting in the lobby to find out what our room number is? This place would never make it if it wasn't connected to Disneyland. Check...

review.author: Jennea R.
review.description: Ah, the original Disneyland hotel. This is the place I stayed at every time I came here when I was a kid. It's a little old fashioned in the inside.. but I think they are re-modeling it a lot....
